bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: United States Mail Steamhip Eliza Anderson Victoria September 26th, 1860

Whereas a Negro Boy called "Charles" the property of James Tilton Esq of Olympia Washington Territory did on the 24th inst run away from his master and secrete himself on board this vessel, and upon the fact being made known to the undersigned the said negro was placed in charge of one of the officers of the Ship that he might be returned to his Master and whereas upon the arrival of the Ship at Victoria a writ of "Habeas Corpus" was signed by Chief Justice Cameron and placed in the hands of the Sheriff of Victoria who demanded of the undersigned the delivery of the said Negro and upon the refusal of the undersigned to deliver the Negro the said Sheriff threatened to force open the room in which the Negro was confined on board of said vessel where upon the undersigned to prevent the destruction of property and in all probablity much bloodshed opened the
door of said room and upon doing so the sheriff took the Negro from on boad said vessel

Now therefore the undersigned protests against the whole proceeding as illegal and a breach of international law, and demands the immediate delivery of the said negro Charles that he may be returned to his master
John R Fleming Captain of U S M Steamship Eliza Anderson
Sworn to and subscribed before me this 26th day of September AD 1860 George Pearkes notary public
